Incident.Summary: Investigation into possible panhandlers on the roadside.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: In car camera operational, A-5 Body Worn Camera operational, TFC Mohr is assigned Axon MSP# 00016850 Evidence Processing: Due to the nature of the incident, scene processing was not conducted. Scene Processing: The witness was interviewed road-side and his information was obtained. Suspect(s): Name: Gunici Leonard Sex: Male Race: Middle Eastern DOB: 11/23/2003 Address: 18 Haley Road Essex, Maryland 21221 Witness/Victim: Travis Garland Boylston Jr. DOB: 06/07/1990 Address: 27540 Persimmon Lane Mechanicsville, Maryland 20659 Narrative: On Monday, January 9, 2023 at approximately 1503 hours, I, Trooper First Class Mohr #6743, assigned to the Maryland State Police (MSP), Waterloo Barrack was on patrol in the area of the northbound ramp from US Route 29 toward westbound I-70 in Ellicott City, Howard County, Maryland. I was operating MSP vehicle, A-5, which is an unmarked, black Ford Explorer, fully equipped with emergency lights and an electronic siren. I was dressed in the MSP uniform of the day. While negotiating the curve, I observed two vehicles, one silver SUV and one gold SUV, both parked on the right shoulder. I observed a gentleman wearing a light blue dress shirt and black dress slacks. He was identified through a passport (Romanian citizen) as Gunici Leonard, DOB: 11/23/2003. Leonard was walking back to the silver SUV by time I exited my patrol vehicle. I observed another male seated in the front seat of the silver SUV. I asked the Leonard, Whos that? He stated he had a ...problem with the gas...I dont speak [real good] English. I introduced myself and stated that he was being recorded. At this time, I observed the other occupant exit the vehicle and approach my location. He presented an ID card that identified him as Florin Ghiocel, DOB: 04/26/2005. I asked if they stopped the driver of the gold SUV and asked him for gas money. I made contact with the driver of the gold SUV, identified by his Maryland drivers license as Travis Garland Boylston JR, DOB: 06/07/1990 and I asked him if they stopped him to ask for a ride to get gas. Boylston stated that the subject in the blue shirt tried to sell him some jewelry in lieu of currency for gas. I obtained the Boylstonsinformation and Ghiocels information and relayed it back to the Waterloo Barrack. The MSP Waterloo Barrack has been plagued consistently with calls for service, varying in areas around the I-95 corridor and Howard County patrol area. Multiple citizen complaints have come through stating that gentlemen would stop or wave them down, were dressed sharply, and would ask them for directions to a store/property or try to exchange a service for a sale of jewelry that was invaluable. Boylston advised that he had to leave the area, so I dismissed him from the scene. After Boylston left the scene, I advised Ghiocel and Leonard to walk toward the front of, A-5, for further instruction. I reached the barrack via telephone and began speaking with the duty officer on duty, Sergeant Krysiak. I was advised to issue a Criminal Citation to Leonard for disorderly conduct. I returned to the front of my vehicle to interview Ghiocel and Leonard. Since Leonard did not speak English, I referred to Ghiocel to relay information after translation. I informed both that they were being detained for a criminal investigation. Miranda Rights to both Ghiocel and Leonard at 1515 hours. They began speaking without a lawyer present after I advised several times that it was their right to acquire one before questioning. I stated that Boylston advised that Leonard stopped Boylston and tried to exchange jewelry for gas money. Leonard began nodding his head after I finished my statement. I stated that a Criminal Citation would be issued for disorderly conduct and that they would not go to jail. A court date would satisfy the charge and I explained the probable cause I had encompassing the disorderly conduct charge. Since Leonard was standing outside the vehicle, on the shoulder, a citation was only issued to him (122002417180). Leonard was explained the nature of the violation and the understanding between Leonard and myself was established. He signed his copy of the citation without incident. Prior to clearing, I issued Leonard his copy of the citation. Both Ghiocel and Leonard got back in their vehicle and left the scene without incident. Case closed via criminal citation issuance. All events occurred in Howard County, Maryland.
